adverb.description: In a way that shows pity and sorrow for someone else's misfortune.
examples: she listened sympathetically to Lizzy's grievances
I smiled sympathetically at the mother

adverb.description: In a way that shows approval of or favor toward an idea or action.
examples: the plea for restraint was treated sympathetically

adverb.description: In a way that attracts the liking of others.
examples: supporters of the campaign were sympathetically portrayed
